Package it.polimi.softeng.model

Class Shelfie

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.softeng.model.Shelfie
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Shelfie extends Object implements Serializable
This class is the representation of shelfie.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shelfie

      public Shelfie()
      It creates the grid object used to represent shelfie.

  • Method Details

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(ArrayList<Tile> tilesToBeInserted, int column) throws IllegalInsertException
      This method takes an arrayList of tiles and, if legal, inserts them into the shelfie.
      Parameters:
      tilesToBeInserted - arraylist of tiles; the tile in position 0 in the arrayList goes first, so on for the following.
      column - int that indicates the selected shelfie column; the numbering goes from left to right (ie 0-->the furthest left).
      Throws:
      IllegalInsertException - exception thrown when there is not enough space in the selected column of the shelfie.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int row, int column)
      Getter method for the shelfie.
      Parameters:
      row - row numbering: goes from bottom to top (ie 0 --> the lowest).
      column - column numbering: goes from sx to dx (ie 0-->the furthest left).
      Returns:
      Tile from the desired position.

    • getGrid

      public Tile[][] getGrid()
      Getter method for when you need the whole grid.
      Returns:
      the Tile matrix representing the shelfie grid.

    • checkFull

      public boolean checkFull()
      This method checks whether the shelfie is full or not by controlling the last row.
      Returns:
      a boolean value.

    • checkLegalInsert

      public boolean checkLegalInsert(ArrayList<Tile> tilesToBeInserted, int column)
      This method checks whether the requested insert is allowed by checking if there are too many tiles for the selected column.
      Parameters:
      tilesToBeInserted - arraylist of tiles.
      column - int that indicates the selected shelfie column; the numbering goes from sx to dx (ie 0-->the furthest left).
      Returns:
      boolean value.

    • insertTileForTesting

      public void insertTileForTesting(ArrayList<Tile> tilesToBeInserted, int column)
      Testing method for tile insertion.
      Parameters:
      tilesToBeInserted - arrayList of tiles to be inserted.
      column - chosen column for the insertion.

    • setGrid

      public void setGrid(int row, int column, int id, Tile.TileColor color)
      This method is used to set a grid in a fast way; it creates a new tile with the desired id and color.
      Parameters:
      row - selected row.
      column - selected column.
      id - id of selected tile.
      color - color of chosen tile.

    • setGridAtNull

      public void setGridAtNull(int row, int column)
      This method sets desired cell of shelfie to null.
      Parameters:
      row - selected row.
      column - selected column.
